channel.title: Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Why does EnumÂ­ProcessÂ­Modules report no modules on a process that was created suspended?
item.description: There are no modules yet because you didn't give them a chance to load. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250526-00/?p=111218

item.title: Announcing General Availability of JavaScript SDK v4 for Azure Cosmos DB
item.description: Weâ€™re excited to launch version 4 of the Azure Cosmos DB JavaScript SDK! This update delivers major improvements that make it easier and faster to build high-performance apps with the Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL API. Version 4 is available now and targets Node.js v18 and above, introducing a host of new capabilities, including: Improved [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/announcing-general-availability-of-javascript-sdk-v4-for-azure-cosmos-db

item.title: Confluent Cloud Releases Managed V2 Kafka Connector for Azure Cosmos DB
item.description: This article was co-authored by Sudhindra Sheshadrivasan, Staff Product Manager at Confluent. Weâ€™re excited to announce the General Availability (GA) of the Confluent Cloud-managed V2 Kafka Connector for Azure Cosmos DB! This release marks a major milestone in our mission to simplify and streamline real-time data streaming from and into Azure Cosmos DB using Apache [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/confluent-cloud-releases-managed-v2-kafka-connector-for-azure-cosmos-db

item.title: Meet the DocumentDB Extension for VS Code and DocumentDB Local â€” A Fast, Friendly Way to Work with DocumentDB, Locally and Beyond
item.description: Say hello to the new DocumentDB extension for Visual Studio Codeâ€”an efficient open-source database tool that brings your MongoDB API and DocumentDB databases right into your editor. Designed for developers building cloud apps, working in hybrid or local setups, or debugging live production systems, this extension lets you browse, manage, and query your data directly [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/meet-the-documentdb-extension-for-vs-code-and-documentdb-local-a-fast-friendly-way-to-work-with-documentdb-locally-and-beyond

item.title: Now in Public Preview: Azure Functions Trigger for Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore
item.description: The Azure Cosmos DB trigger for Azure Functions is now in public previewâ€”available for C# Azure Functions using Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore! This new capability allows developers to easily trigger Azure Functions in response to changes in a MongoDB vCore collection, making it simple to build real-time, event-driven applications with minimal setup. ğŸ” [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/now-in-public-preview-azure-functions-trigger-for-azure-cosmos-db-for-mongodb-vcore

item.title: How can I detect if one of my helper processes is launching child processes?
item.description: You can ask a job object to keep track for you. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250523-00/?p=111216

item.title: Durable Functions for Indexing in RAG: A Practical Python Approach
item.description: Azure Durable Functions streamline RAG indexing by combining push flexibility with pull reliability for scalable, Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/ise/durable-functions-for-rag-indexing

item.title: Office Add-ins announces Copilot agents with add-in actions and more at Build 2025
item.description: As part of the expanding capabilities for agents across Microsoft 365, Office Platform announces add-in actions for Copilot agents are available in preview. This blog is an overview of all the new capabilities across the platform: APIs, developer tools, and add-in distribution optionsâ€”making it simpler to build new or iterate on JavaScript add-ins. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/office-addins-at-build-2025

item.title: Now Available: Migrate from RU to vCore for Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB via Azure Portal
item.description: We are thrilled to introduce a cost-effective, simple, and efficient solution for migrating from RU-based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB to vCore-based. You can now move to vCore-based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB at no cost using the Azure portal.Â How is the vCore model different?Â Azure Cosmos DB offers two pricing models: Request Units [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/migrate-mongo-db-ru-to-vcore

item.title: New AI Features in SQL Server 2025
item.description: We have some great new AI Features in SQL Server 2025. I also figured a video would be better than reading a blogâ€¦. but, you can also read all about it here. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/new-ai-features-in-sql-server-2025

item.title: Generally Available: Seamless Migration from Serverless to Provisioned Throughput in Azure Cosmos DB
item.description: We are excited to announce the general availability (GA) of a highly requested capability in Azure Cosmos DB: the ability to migrate from serverless to provisioned throughput modeâ€”without manual recreation, or downtime. This release builds on the momentum of our public preview and is now fully supported across all regions. Why it matters Azure Cosmos [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/generally-available-seamless-migration-from-serverless-to-provisioned-throughput-in-azure-cosmos-db

item.title: Public Preview: Shape and Control Workloads with Throughput Buckets in Azure Cosmos DB
item.description: Imagine your application is processing customer checkouts in real-time, while a background process synchronizes data for reporting. Suddenly, the seamless user experience falters because the sync job consumes more RU/s than anticipated.Â Many teams face a common challenge: multiple workloads share the same container resources, yet each has different performance requirements.Â Weâ€™re excited to introduce [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/public-preview-shape-and-control-workloads-with-throughput-buckets-in-azure-cosmos-db

item.title: Introducing the Agent Store: Build, publish, and discover agents in Microsoft 365 Copilot
item.description: Weâ€™re excited to introduce the Agent Store â€” a centralized, curated marketplace that features agents built by Microsoft, trusted partners, and customers. The Agent Store offers a new, immersive experience within Microsoft 365 Copilot that enables users to browse, install, and try agents tailored to their needs. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/introducing-the-agent-store-build-publish-and-discover-agents-in-microsoft-365-copilot

item.title: Announcing TypeScript Native Previews
item.description: This past March we unveiled our efforts to port the TypeScript compiler and toolset to native code. This port has achieved a 10x speed-up on most projects â€“ not just by using a natively-compiled language (Go), but also through using shared memory parallelism and concurrency where we can benefit. Since then, we have made several [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-native-previews

item.title: Microsoft Entra ID integration with Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore)
item.description: Security is no longer a nice-to-haveâ€”itâ€™s a foundational requirement for any cloud-native architecture. As organizations adopt managed database services to support mission-critical applications, they must prioritize robust, scalable, and centralized security. Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore) delivers high performance and flexibility, but it provides the most value when paired with well-implemented security practices. Authentication [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/microsoft-entra-id-integration-with-azure-cosmos-db-for-mongodb-vcore

item.title: How can I create a window the size of the screen without it being treated as a fullscreen window?
item.description: You can declare that you aren't rude. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250522-00/?p=111211

item.title: Foundry Local: A New Era of Edge AI
item.description: At Microsoft Build 2025, Microsoft unveiled its groundbreakingÂ Foundry LocalÂ solution for edge devicesâ€”an efficient platform specifically designed for local AI inference. As a critical component of Microsoftâ€™s AI strategy, Foundry Local empowers developers to smoothly deploy and run Small Language Models (SLMs) on resource-constrained edge devices, opening new possibilities for the convergence of edge computing and [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/foundry/foundry-local-a-new-era-of-edge-ai

item.title: DiskANN and Filtered Vector Search are Now Generally Available in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore)
item.description: Weâ€™re excited to announce general availability of DiskANN and Filtered Vector Search on Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore), starting with M30 cluster tiers and above. You can now use these features in production to store and query vector embeddings directly alongside your operational dataâ€”efficiently and in one integrated vector database.Â DiskANN Indexing: Scaling Vector [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/diskann-in-azure-cosmos-db-for-mongodb

item.title: Connect Once, Integrate Anywhere with MCP
item.description: In the fast-paced world of AI development, connecting intelligent applications to the tools and data sources they need can be challenging. Thatâ€™s why Model Context Protocol (MCP) is resonating with some many, an open standard thatâ€™s transforming how developers integrate AI capabilities into their applications. MCP enables you to â€œconnect once, integrate anywhereâ€ by creating [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/connect-once-integrate-anywhere-with-mcps

item.title: AI and Vector Data Extensions are now Generally Available (GA)
item.description: Weâ€™re excited to announce that these extensions are now generally available, providing developers with a robust foundation to build scalable, maintainable, and interoperable AI-powered applications. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/ai-vector-data-dotnet-extensions-ga

item.title: MSSQL Extension for VS Code: Introducing Schema Designer (Preview)
item.description: Overview Database design can often feel like navigating a maze of tables, relationships, and data types â€” especially when working directly with T-SQL scripts. But what if you could map out your database, make changes to your tables, and manage complex schemas within a graphical interface? We are excited to announce the Public Preview of [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/vs-code-mssql-schema-designer

item.title: Connecting to Private NuGet Feeds Just Got Easier
item.description: The Visual Studio 2022 17.14 update is here, and it brings great quality-of-life improvementsâ€”especially around NuGet authentication. From context about the authentication needs of private NuGet feeds to a simplified account selection workflow, this update helps you stay focused on your code! If you havenâ€™t already, download the latest Visual Studio update to take advantage [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/connecting-to-private-nuget-feeds-just-got-easier

item.title: AI Shell Preview 4 Release!
item.description: We're excited to share the latest preview release of AI Shell that includes new features and improvements based on your feedback. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/preview-4-ai-shell

item.title: Now in Preview: Azure Cosmos DB Fleets
item.description: Weâ€™re excited to announce the preview of Azure Cosmos DB fleets. Azure Cosmos DB fleets address common challenges that developers face when building and managing multi-tenant or Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Today, many SaaS providers using Azure Cosmos DB isolate each tenant in a separate database account to meet strict performance and security [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/now-in-preview-azure-cosmos-db-fleets

item.title: Semantic Kernel and Microsoft.Extensions.AI: Better Together, Part 1
item.description: This is the start of a series highlighting the integration between Microsoft Semantic Kernel and Microsoft.Extensions.AI. Future parts will provide detailed examples of using Semantic Kernel with Microsoft.Extensions.AI abstractions.Â The most common questions are:Â â€œDo Microsoftâ€™s AI extensions replace Semantic Kernel?â€Â â€œWhen should I use Microsoftâ€™s AI extensions instead of Semantic Kernel?â€Â This blog post [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/semantic-kernel-and-microsoft-extensions-ai-better-together-part-1

item.title: Transitioning to new Extensions AI IEmbeddingGenerator interface
item.description: As Semantic Kernel shifts its foundational abstractions to Microsoft.Extensions.AI, we are obsoleting and moving away from our experimental embeddings interfaces to the new standardized abstractions that provide a more consistent and powerful way to work with AI services across the .NET ecosystem. The Evolution of Embedding Generation in Semantic Kernel Semantic Kernel has always aimed [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/transitioning-to-new-iembeddinggenerator-interface

item.title: Azure MCP Server â€“ May 2025 Release
item.description: This post discusses the updates to the Azure MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server for Microsoft //build 2025. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azure-mcp-server-may-2025-release

item.title: Introducing the Microsoft 365 Agents Toolkit
item.description: Read how the Microsoft 365 Agents Toolkit, an evolution of Microsoft Teams Toolkit, is designed to help developers build agents and apps for Microsoft 365 Copilot, Microsoft Teams, and Microsoft 365. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/introducing-the-microsoft-365-agents-toolkit

item.title: Azure DevOps with GitHub Repositories â€“ Your path to Agentic AI
item.description: GitHub Copilot has evolved beyond a coding assistant in the IDE into an agentic teammate â€“ providing actionable feedback on pull requests, fixing bugs and implementing new features, creating pull requests and responding to feedback, and much more. These new capabilities will transform every aspect of the software development lifecycle, as we are already seeing [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/azure-devops-with-github-repositories-your-path-to-agentic-ai

item.title: Announcing Azure Command Launcher for Java
item.description: Optimizing JVM Configuration for Azure Deployments Tuning the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) for cloud deployments is notoriously challenging. Over 30% of developers tend to deploy Java workloads with no JVM configuration at all, therefore relying on the default settings of the HotSpot JVM. The default settings in OpenJDK are intentionally conservative, designed to work across [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/java/announcing-azure-command-launcher-for-java

item.title: Why does Windows report my processor speed twice, with slightly different values?
item.description: One is calculated. The other is self-promotion. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250520-00/?p=111201
